Class Game

java.lang.Object
  Game

public class Game
extends java.lang.Object

The main game class for the Lucky Vending Machine. Allows a user to set up a new player, guess a prize, view winnings, and read game instructions. Uses the Player and LuckyGuessGenerator classes.

Version:
1.2 23 Apr 2015
Author:
Bai Chan Kheo

          Display the in-game help menu.

          This method displays the game menu for the Lucky Vending Machine game.

          Prints out a table of all the prizes available and its corresponding worth and cost.

Constructor Detail

Game

public Game()
Constructor method for the Game class.

Method Detail

compareLuckyNumber

public void compareLuckyNumber(int newGuess)
Compares the number inputted with a random number generated by the generator object. If it is the same, the player object will be updated with details of the new prize they have won.

displayHelp

public void displayHelp()
Display the in-game help menu. Includes a table of all the prizes.

displayMenu

public void displayMenu()
This method displays the game menu for the Lucky Vending Machine game.

displayTable

public void displayTable()
Prints out a table of all the prizes available and its corresponding worth and cost.

exitGame

public void exitGame()
Stops the Lucky Vending Machine game.

guessPrize

public void guessPrize()
This method prompts the user for a guess, checks that it is valid, and then compares it to the number generated by the generator object. If it is the same, the player wins.

newPlayer

public void newPlayer()
This method allows the user to create a new player using the Player class. This new player will overwrite any existing players. This method prompts the user for their name and checks that its length is greater than 0 characters.

pressEnter

public void pressEnter()
This method prompts the user to press the [ENTER] key to continue.

startGame

public void startGame()
This method starts the Lucky Vending Machine game. It will continue to display the game menu to the player and prompt for input until the player wishes to exit the game.
